title: The Hidden Breath of Villa Jasmin
tagline: When the empire's ledger comes to claim a home, the land itself begins to remember.

chapters.title: The Monsoon Arrived Not With Rain
The Dream Was Always the Same
The Weight of the Afternoon Heat

story: Write a scene where a mundane object in the house (a spoon, a tile, a window latch) 'remembers' and reveals a hidden history to Amaya during the inventory.
Compose the 17th-century court poet's treatise on jasmine that Arjun is translating, blending horticulture with veiled political allegory.
Write a 'ghost ledger' entry from the perspective of the house itself, cataloging the emotions and events imprinted on its walls, counter to Carrington's official inventory.
Draft a mythic origin story for the 'hum in the soil' that Amaya dreams of, connecting it to a local legend of a buried guardian or a silenced protest.
technical: Build an interactive 'Mythic Map' of Villa Jasmin's grounds, where users can click on features (the walled garden, the old stone basin, the frangipani tree) to reveal layered narratives: Carrington's clinical description, Amaya's sensory memory, and the land's mythic recollection.

Create a 'Clause Generator' that produces procedurally generated, legalese 'Annexures' from the fictional Independence Accord, each describing a new way to legally dispossess, which can be used as writing prompts for additional scenes of bureaucratic encroachment.

council: Kazuo Ishiguro (Memory, Silence, & The Aftermath of History)
Arundhati Roy (Lyrical Protest & The Politics of Place)

cover_prompt: A spectral, ancient banyan tree's roots erupt through the elegant, cracked tile floor of a colonial-era villa's grand hall, its sinuous limbs cradling and shattering a heavy, leather-bound ledger, [Detailed Scene & Context: within the decaying opulence of Villa Jasmin, where architectural ghosts—faded wallpaper patterns that shift into faces, and floorboards that gleam like water—hold memory. A single, empty chair sits at a desk piled with yellowed official stamps and rusted seals, the bureaucracy of loss made physical], [Artistic Style & Medium: in the hauntingly detailed and mythic style of Zdzisław Beksiński, blended with the ethereal, memory-laden atmospheres of Remedios Varo, rendered in photorealistic oil painting with subtle textural elements of aged parchment and cracked fresco], [Composition & Camera: book cover framing, a centered and immersive composition looking down the villa's long, perspective-driven hallway, with a low-angle view emphasizing the towering, invasive tree, dramatic and slightly surreal], [Lighting & Color Palette: chiaroscuro lighting with a single shaft of dusty, golden-hour light piercing through a high, broken window, illuminating the floating dust and spectral forms, within a palette of colonial blues, faded ochre, monsoon grey, and the vibrant, impossible green of the living myth], masterpiece, best quality, ultra detailed, intricate details, professional composition, sharp focus, 8k resolution, flux dev.
